instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no thunderbolt
threads.message: Customer complained of no thunderbolt. No liquid damage. What to check first? 3.3V on both sides of <DIODE>D9425</DIODE>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no thunderbolt
threads.message:
Check solders, traces and adiacent components of J9400.
<SIGNAL>T29_A_HV_EN</SIGNAL> goes high when connect a Thundebolt device?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no thunderbolt
threads.message:
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]Solders traces and components of J9400 look fine.

<SIGNAL>T29_A_HV_EN</SIGNAL> 0V with connected thunderbolt device[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no thunderbolt
threads.message: Refering to J9400, check <SIGNAL>DP_PWR</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>HOT_PLUG_DETECT</SIGNAL>, w/ and w/o TBT device connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no thunderbolt
threads.message: solved on its own after measuring for <SIGNAL>DP_PWR</SIGNAL>
